start of the game.text:
It is very dark. Cold and dark. You find yourself on an unfamiliar place at who knows what hours of the night, but you don't feel trapped at all. After all, you recall walking here by yourself earlier and could easily repeat it in reverse.
But, you're not so sure WHY you're here, and that frightens you. A whim? Did you just wander for hours without destination and just now noticed how lost you may be? Was this just an evening walk with one too many turns? The fact you can't remember how you got here unnerves you a lot more than your present location.
You should try to relax, you tell to yourself, no good decisions come from under stress. As your eyes slowly get used to the darkness, you decide to look up at the night sky. Just for a bit. If not to admire how many stars you can see here, whenever you are. And seeing them does help to ease, to reassure you truly aren't trapped away in some dark cave or something.
You focus on your hearing to better your bearings, as your eyes are still lagging behind in usefulness. Tree leaves whistle as some soft wind passes by. Crickets pepper the air all around, an owl hoots in the distance. And as seemingly far, you can listen to an occasional chugging of... car wheels on asphalt? Okay, that's good, there must be a road nearby! It seemed to come from your %c0%left%e%!
Makes sense, that's the way you recall you took to get here.
The black outlines that surround you are not more than pine trees. And the hardness bellow your feet is of a dirt path you're in. You feel a bit more relieved at the tranquillity around you and the muted sounds of civilization, not too far away.
Welp, you should probably get going. Or do something else than standing around in the adumbrate. What are you going to do?

resume of the game.text:
It is very dark. Cold and dark. You find yourself on an unfamiliar place...
Wait a second. No, you do %c0%recognize%e% this place. You can barely see but this is clearly the forest clearing. THE forest clearing.
Was... was everything that happened so far a dream? An hallucination? Or did you just pass out and... somehow returned here? You do seem to have everything with you...
Ugh, no time to think, let's get this on the road.

resume of the game 2.text:
It is very dark. Cold and dark. You find yourself on an unfamiliar place...
Ugh, %c0%not again%e%, you're back in that forest clearing. Did you pass out again? Anyway, stuff's in order, let's go.

More, you %c0%remember%e% the sunrise. You recall all the days and nights since then, as hazely as your memory allows. You can't expect to remember what you had for breakfast 3 days ago, right?
Anyway, you're back here. Why? Was something left undone? Wait, did YOU think that? Seems those aliens thoughts are back too, and with a revenge. Something that you were destined to do is still undone, and has to be done post-haste!
Maybe.
Seems it'll be yet again one more long night.

check surroundings in forest clearing.text:
With your eyes finally used to the darkness of the night, you can kinda see what surrounds you in the moment. Alright, let's do the inventory.
Trees.
More trees.
Even more trees, these ones are shorter!
A rock.
Yet more trees.
The floor, which is a mixture of loose gravel and short grass.
You forgot to mention to yourself all the trees are pine trees, too. Expect that one, you're not quite sure what it is, but the branches are too thick to be a pine tree, and the needle leaves too sparce.
Oh, okay, you were wrong, that one "tree" is actually a signpost. Talk about convenient.
You take a quick glance at the signpost and %c0%memorize%e%%m0% it for later. After all it has a helpful plaque for each of the individual paths you see out of this forest clearing, except for one, to where you heard cars earlier, the way you came from.
